Susan Rice to be Obama's national security adviser

President Barack Obama’s top national security adviser Tom Donilon is resigning and will be replaced by US ambassador to the United Nations Susan Rice, marking a significant shakeup to the White House foreign policy team. (10:01 a.m.)
  • Loading comments... | Add yours Share now:

A-Rod, others could face suspension

An anti-aging clinic's founder will talk to Major League Baseball about players linked to performance-enhancing drugs. Alex Rodriguez is one player with ties to the clinic who could face suspension.

Newtown gets privacy

Lawmakers passed a bill preventing the release of photo and video evidence from the Sandy Hook school massacre and other Connecticut homicides.
